intro: Pabstia jugosa, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Pabstia jugosa is adapted to survive in harsh, arid conditions with minimal water availability.
